A system consists of a ball of mass M2 and a uniform rod of mass M1 and length d. The rod is attached to a horizontal frictionless table by a pivot at point P and initially rotates at an angular speed ùúî , as shown above left. The rotational inertia of the rod about point P is   1 3 M 1 d 2 . The rod strikes the ball, which is initially at rest. As a result of this collision, the rod is stopped and the ball moves in the direction shown above right. Express all answers in terms of M1 , M2 , ùúî, d, and fundamental constants.

  1. Derive an expression for the angular momentum of the rod about point P before the collision.

  2. Derive an expression for the speed v of the ball after the collision.

  3. Assuming that this collision is elastic, calculate the numerical value of the ratio M1 / M2 .

  4. A new ball with the same mass M1 as the rod is now placed a distance x from the pivot, as shown above. Again assuming the collision is elastic, for what value of x will the rod stop moving after hitting the ball?
